description: An L-tile is a 2 X 2 square with the upper 1 X 1 subsquare removed; no rotations are allowed. a(n) = number of tilings of a 4 X n rectangle using tiles that are either 1 X 1 squares or L-tiles.
references: E. Deutsch, Counting tilings with L-tiles and squares, Problem 10877, Amer. Math. Monthly, 110 (March 2003), 245-246.
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,5,4,0,-1).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 07 2003
